newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: RAILWAY COMPANY POSTS Q1 PROFIT.
newsitem.headline: RAILWAY COMPANY POSTS Q1 PROFIT.

text.p: Lithuanian Railways said on Tuesday that it made a net profit of 2.59 million litas in the first three months of this year compared to losses of 6.94 million litas in the same period last year.
The company also said in a statement that its income for the first three months of 1997 was 160.55 million litas, up from 134.48 million litas in the same period in 1996.

The bulk of its income came from cargo transportation, rising to 131.51 million litas in the first quarter of this year from 103.18 million litas in the corresponding period last year, an increase of 27.5 percent.
Income from passengers fell in the first quarter to 17.21 million litas from 18.1 million litas in the first quarter of 1996.
The company earlier said that it carried 2.834 million passengers in the first three months of 1997 compared to 3.321 million last year.
The state-run company is on a list of strategic enterprises which will not be privatised before the year 2000.
